title: Russian Troops in Belarus Spur Debate Over the Threat to Ukraine
description: The United States and its allies are playing down the dangers posed by the deployment of thousands of Russian soldiers to Belarus, but the intelligence assessments come with a dose of uncertainty.

title: Zelensky Accuses Russia of Deliberately Slowing Grain Shipments
description: The U.N. confirmed a backlog of 150 ships waiting to fulfill contracts to transport Ukrainian food products, a delay that comes as a deadline to renew a grain deal nears.

title: How a Prison Fire Unfolded in Iran
description: The cause of the fire last weekend remains unclear, but witnesses and families of prisoners say that the authorities had been bracing for unrest in the notorious Evin Prison in northern Tehran.

title: Giorgia Meloni Gets Go-Ahead for New Italian Government
description: The hard-right leader will be sworn in on Saturday as the country’s first female prime minister amid questions about her coalition’s commitment to Europe.

title: Imran Khan, Pakistan’s Ex-Leader, Is Barred From Office
description: The decision by Pakistan’s election commission is a major escalation of the showdown between the ruling establishment and Mr. Khan, and it raises the specter of unrest.

title: Security Forces Open Fire on Protesters in Chad, Killing at Least 50
description: Demonstrators had taken to the streets, demanding that the ruling military junta stick to its promises to hold elections.

title: Swedish Speed Cameras Keep Getting Stolen. Is It Russia?
description: The disappearance of the pricey cameras from rural roads is a mystery. Theories abound on why the cameras have become such a target.

title: British Lawmaker Quits After Watchdog Finds Him Guilty of Sexual Misconduct
description: The findings came after a complaint from a junior staffer that the lawmaker, Christian Matheson, had made unwanted advances on her. Mr. Matheson denied any sexual misconduct, but resigned.

title: In Shattered Homes, Ukrainians Brace for a Cold Winter
description: In cities and towns battered by the war, residents worry about how to heat their homes as temperatures drop. But even in places spared from the worst of the fighting, Russian strikes on infrastructure have raised new fears.

title: Who Will the Next U.K. Prime Minister Be and How Will They Be Chosen?
description: The process, which does not include the general public, will be swift, with plans to have a result by next week.

title: Brazilian Official Granted Power to Order Removal of Misinformation Online
description: Brazilian authorities granted the country’s elections chief broad power to order the takedown of online content in a bid to combat soaring misinformation ahead of this month’s election.

title: Zelensky Warns Russia Plans to Blow Up a Major Dam in a ‘False Flag’ Attack
description: The Ukrainian president called for an international observation mission at the dam’s hydroelectric plant to prevent a potential catastrophe.

title: The Race for a New British Prime Minister Begins, Again
description: Former Prime Minister Boris Johnson and the man who helped oust him from his job, the former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak, are seen as two of the top contenders within the governing Conservative Party.

title: Liz Truss’s Downfall
description: Liz Truss is inflation’s latest political victim, and probably not its last.

title: 5 Australian Women Sue Qatar Over Invasive Searches at Airport
description: The women say that they have suffered lasting trauma from the episode and are pushing for policy changes.

title: How Australia Fell Behind on Data Privacy
description: A recent spate of cyberattacks have highlighted the nation’s relatively lax approach to safeguarding personal data. But change may be on the way.

title: Zelensky Calls for Observer Mission at Key Hydroelectric Dam
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine warned that Russia was preparing to blow up a large hydroelectric dam in the south of the country, threatening the city of Kherson.

title: Hasta la Vista? This Time, Boris Johnson May Say, ‘I’m Back’
description: A comeback by Mr. Johnson is viewed as a very real possibility, delighting some Conservative Party lawmakers and repelling others.

title: Cough Syrup: What We Know About Tainted Medicine from India
description: Tainted syrup from India may be connected to the deaths of dozens of children in Gambia, officials said. Indonesia banned cough syrup sales, though the link there is unclear.

title: She’s Inheriting Millions of Euros. She Wants Her Wealth Taxed Away.
description: Marlene Engelhorn, 30, heir to a fortune, isn’t interested in philanthropy, believing it only perpetuates existing power dynamics. She’s calling for structural change to how the ultrarich are taxed.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Liz Truss resigns.

title: As Inflation Stalks Europe, Leaders Shudder
description: The downfall of Britain’s prime minister served as a warning to all of the political peril that awaits those who fail to address the erosion of living standards, no matter the cause.
